casebody.data:
No. 5,

Original, October Term, 1950.

New Jersey v. New York et al. Denis M. Hurley, John P. McGrath, Jeremiah M. Evarts, James J. Thornton and Richard H. Burke for the City of New York. Theodore D. Parsons, Attorney General, Robert Peacock, Deputy Attorney General, and Kenneth H. Murray for the State of New Jersey.

The motion of the City of New York for leave to file an amended petition to modify the decree is granted and the parties are allowed thirty days within which to answer the amended petition.
